### PR summary [dc8e2e9d89](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15965/commits/dc8e2e9d8954595abf6a8b27f1fa9602d9172ab8)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Data.List.Pairwise | 275 | 242 | -33 (-12.00%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.Indexes | 344 | 335 | -9 (-2.62%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.OfFn | 331 | 323 | -8 (-2.42%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.Range | 333 | 334 | +1 (+0.30%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.Sort | 347 | 348 | +1 (+0.29%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.NodupEquivFin | 349 | 350 | +1 (+0.29%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.List | 432 | 433 | +1 (+0.23%) |
| Mathlib.Data.List.Cycle | 460 | 461 | +1 (+0.22%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Cycle.Concrete | 821 | 822 | +1 (+0.12%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 3308 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 141626 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ dropWhile_get_zero_not`
`+ getElem_range'_1`
`+ get_cons`
`+ get_mapIdx`
`+ get_rotate_one`
`+ get_tail`
`+ prev_get`
`- Forall₂.nthLe`
`- Nodup.nthLe_inj_iff`
`- Sorted.rel_nthLe_of_le`
`- Sorted.rel_nthLe_of_lt`
`- drop_take_succ_eq_cons_nthLe`
`- duplicate_iff_exists_distinct_nthLe`
`- ext_nthLe`
`- forall₂_iff_nthLe`
`- forall₂_of_length_eq_of_nthLe`
`- formPerm_apply_lt`
`- formPerm_apply_nthLe`
`- formPerm_apply_nthLe_length`
`- formPerm_apply_nthLe_zero`
`- formPerm_pow_apply_nthLe`
`- mem_iff_nthLe`
`- next_nthLe`
`- nodup_iff_nthLe_inj`
`- nthLe`
`- nthLe_append_right`
`- nthLe_cons_aux`
`- nthLe_cons_length`
`- nthLe_get?`
`- nthLe_insertNth_add_succ`
`- nthLe_insertNth_of_lt`
`- nthLe_insertNth_self`
`- nthLe_map`
`- nthLe_map'`
`- nthLe_map_rev`
`- nthLe_mem`
`- nthLe_ofFn`
`- nthLe_ofFn'`
`- nthLe_of_mem`
`- nthLe_permutations'Aux`
`- nthLe_pmap`
`- nthLe_reverse`
`- nthLe_reverse'`
`- nthLe_rotate`
`- nthLe_rotate'`
`- nthLe_singleton`
`- nthLe_succ_scanl`
`- nthLe_toList`
`- nthLe_zero_scanl`
`- nthLe_zip`
`- nthLe_zipWith`
`- nth_le_inits`
`- nth_le_tails`
`- ofFn_nthLe`
`- pairwise_iff_nthLe`
`- prev_nthLe`
`- toList_nthLe_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Great PR, I look forward to this landing! Let me label this with awaiting-CI, as this seems to on its pass to passing.
Likely whenever the linter complains, the right thing to do is just remove the `simp` attribute. There are overlapping `simp` lemmas in Lean 4.
@Parcly-Taxel, I pushed a commit implementing @mattrobball's request from the original PR.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10463993518/job/28976877311)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10463993518/job/28976877466)
I think these can't be deleted yet: they need to be `@[deprecated]` first.

The continued existence of `nthLe` and other lemmas depending on it is an embarrassment to mathlib and the sooner they are purged the better. I don't think we can afford to wait a whole year to deprecate them.

As a compromise I can add deprecated aliases for the lemmas that were not already deprecated in favour of another lemma – but `nthLe` itself will stay completely removed. Is that OK?

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove >1 year deprecations
